messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] really DUMB postal question ...
messages.msgSnippet: Pris, you have been out in the sun or rain too long.  Go in, make some tea and sit down, close your eyes and relax.  You are obviously over exerting yourself.
messages.messageBody:
Pris, you have been out in the sun or rain too long. Go in, make some tea
and sit down, close your eyes and relax. You are obviously over exerting
yourself. Logic and post office in the same sentence are not compatible!!!
That is like honest and politician! Like saying cod liver oil and good
tasting. Kids and clean. Real descriptions and real estate ads.

Trying to understand how the post service works will cause extreme
migraines. Take two aspirin and e-mail us in the morning <<<BEWG>>>

Lynda

----------
> From: Pris <x_t_sipr@...>
> To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] really DUMB postal question ...
> Date: Thursday, June 29, 2000 11:33 AM
>
> normally, I use groc bags, too but I've been trying to cut down on the
> weight of the pkgs to keep the postage costs down a bit ...
>
> I just don't understand the logic behind how a flimsy envelope is
acceptable
> in the po eyes while a sturdy/taped cardboard box isn't??? huh???
>
> Pris ~> who'z always wondering 'bout th(a)ngs ...
>
>
>
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Lynda <lurine@...>
> To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
> Sent: Thursday, June 29, 2000 1:21 PM
> Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] really DUMB postal question ...
>
>
> > I always wrap everything in a brown grocery bag so they can't see what
> kind
> > of box I use.
> >
> > Lynda
> >
> > ----------
> > > From: Pris <x_t_sipr@...>
> > > To: Unschooling-dotcom <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
> > > Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] really DUMB postal question ...
> > > Date: Thursday, June 29, 2000 10:00 AM
> > >
> > > HEY??? I've got a ??? ... I just received a book I bought from ebay
..
> > > thankfully, the book arrived in perfect condition considering how it
was
> > > mailed!!! the person used a manilla envelope wrapped the book in
bubble
> > > wrap to protect the books but that's it!!! the other day I sold a
book
> > on
> > > vegsource and I wrapped my pkg in a dept store shirt box BUT the
postal
> > > worker gave me the HARDEST TIME saying I couldn't insure the pkg b/c
> they
> > > (po) wouldn't take responsibility since I'd used a shirt box ...
HUH???
> > my
> > > pkg was more securely wrapped (I love using tape, btw, lots and lots
of
> > tape
> > > <G>) ... anyone have any postal experiences??? these people drive me
> > > *crazy* or should I say *POSTAL*!!! haha ...
> > >
> > > Pris ~> who'z scratchin her head over this one ...
>
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] really DUMB postal question ...
messages.msgSnippet: ... oops, you re right, I DO GET MIGRAINES and have HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE, so I d best be careful!!! haha ... now, that s a super idea for a brand new thread;
messages.messageBody:
... oops, you're right, I DO GET MIGRAINES and have HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE, so
I'd best be careful!!! haha ...

now, that's a super idea for a brand new thread; oxymorons ... go w/ it,
Lynda <G>
Pris

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] really DUMB postal question ...
messages.msgSnippet: normally, I use groc bags, too but I ve been trying to cut down on the weight of the pkgs to keep the postage costs down a bit ... I just don t understand the
messages.messageBody:
normally, I use groc bags, too but I've been trying to cut down on the
weight of the pkgs to keep the postage costs down a bit ...

I just don't understand the logic behind how a flimsy envelope is acceptable
in the po eyes while a sturdy/taped cardboard box isn't??? huh???

Pris ~> who'z always wondering 'bout th(a)ngs ...
